medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began three months after a radical neck dissection for thyroid cancer. Initially, the patient reported mild pain and weakness in the right shoulder, which evolved to substantial pain rated 5/10 on a VAS after the surgery. The patient developed a grinding sensation and deliberately limited shoulder motion, leading to increased pain with minimal use.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of radical neck dissection for thyroid cancer, right trapezius palsy, open repair of massive rotator cuff tear with acromioplasty six years ago, bilateral total knee replacement, and left rotator cuff repair. Postsurgical radiation received.
medical_history.social_history: Quit smoking in 1991, no history of alcohol consumption.
